items.message: High tides on Monday may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible for 2 hours either side of Monday morning's tide at 11:30 on 20/10/2025. The weather increases tide table values by 0.38 m. Total forecast tide is 6.10 metres Chart Datum (3.05 mAOD) at Littlehampton. Strong Southerly Force 7 wind. Small amounts of water will flood land and fields at Climping. Waves will overtop the sea front, directing water westwards along Mill Lane (from the right of the East car park) towards properties on Climping Street. Water may pond near property and in Climping Street Car Park. Monday's tide at 23:45 on 20/10/2025 is forecast to be 24 cm lower (2.81 mAOD). We are closely monitoring the situation. We routinely check the condition of the beach at Climping. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have. Access could be restricted. Take care if visiting Climping beach. This message will be updated by 03:00 PM on 20/10/2025.

items.description: South Cornwall coast from Gribbin Head to Rame Head
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible over the high tide on Mon morning and evening. High water at Plymouth is at 5:56am and18:06pm, times of high water will vary along the coast. Strong winds and large waves are forecast to cause flooding between 5:56 am and 18:06 pm. Locations particularly at risk include low lying areas including Fore Street, Town Quay, Albert Quay and Caffa Mill Car park at Fowey, Quay Street and Recreation ground at Lostwithiel, Polperro Harbour, Quay Road and The Quay at Looe and the B3247 at Seaton

Large waves and spray are likely so take care near the coast. Do not walk or drive through flood water or waves. Coastal conditions should ease for Tues morning's high tide. We are monitoring the situation and will update this information by 5pm on Monday, or if the situation changes. 
Detailed tidal information; The forecast high tide level at Plymouth on Monday am 2.11 mAOD and pm 2.24 mAOD pm.  Expect tide levels along the coast to be between 0.39 am and 0.29pm above tide table level.  Force 6 westerly winds and offshore wave heights of over 3m are forecast over the high tide.

High tides and forecast weather conditions tomorrow morning may lead to flooding.
Flooding is possible around the high tide from 8:00 AM on 20/10/2025.
Areas most at risk include Christchurch Harbour and tidal stretches of the Lower Stour and Avon.
We do not expect to see similar impacts from the high tide tomorrow evening.
We are closely monitoring the situationÂ .
Start acting on your flood plan if you have one.
The detailed tidal forecast for those who use it is for a peak level at Christchurch Harbour of 1.32 mAODN at 9:15 AM on 20/10/2025, with southerly fresh breeze force 5 winds. (mAODN is height above average sea level.)
This message will be updated by 12:00 noon on 20/10/2025, or as the situation changes.

The water level in the Monks Brook is high and rising. In the last 6 hours, about 19mm of rainfall has been recorded in Portswood, which is a significant amount of rainfall in a short time. From 18:45 this evening, 19/10/2025, the river will rise to bankfull. It will be deep and fast flowing. The recreational ground at Fleming Park will experience flooding, and the river will be very high at Kingfisher Road. Surface water flooding in roads affecting Chandlers Ford and at Stoneham Way from Chestnut Way to the M27 is also possible. Further heavy rain will continue over the next hour. Our operational staff will keep the river free of reported blockages in Chandlers Ford and Eastleigh. We continue to monitor the forecast. Residents should remain vigilant, especially in Chandlers Ford, where culverts and debris screens in the river can block quickly. Please report blockages to our incident hotline on 0800 807060. This Flood Alert will be updated at 09:00 on 20/10/2025.
